[[Morgoth]] | language= | birth=''Possibly'' {{FA|425}}[[Uldor#Uldor's year of birth|NB]] | birthlocation=East of [[Ered Luin]] | rule= | death={{FA|472}} | deathlocation=[[Nirnaeth Arnoediad]] | age=47 | notablefor= | house= | parentage=[[Ulfang]] | siblings=[[Ulfast]] & [[Ulwarth]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Uldor the Accursed''' was the eldest son[[Uldor#Uldor's year of birth|NB]] of [[Ulfang]] the Black. He was called "the Accursed" most likely due to his role as the leader of the infamous treachery of his [[Folk of Uldor|folk]] in the [[Battle of Unnumbered Tears]]. == History == After entering [[Beleriand]], Uldor along with his father and his brothers joined the service of [[Caranthir]],{{S|18}} and settled in [[Thargelion]]. Ultimately though, his father Ulfang's purpose from the beginning was to eventually betray the [[Elves]],{{GA|174}}, pp. 60-1, ''footnote'' which his sons ultimately did in the [[Battle of Unnumbered Tears]], under Uldor's leadership - they turned against their allies, attacking them in the rear. Their betrayal proved crucial in the fight against Morgoth's forces, though, and Morgoth was victorious. However, Uldor's brothers [[Ulfast]] and [[Ulwarth]] were killed by the sons of [[Bór]], who remained loyal to the sons of [[Fëanor]] during the battle - while Uldor himself was slain by [[Maglor]].{{S|20}} == Genealogy[[Uldor#Uldor's year of birth|NB]] == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | | | ULG | | | | |ULG=[[Ulfang]]

''Uldor'' m.|dated=|website=Eldamo|accessed=22 August 2023}}While ''[[Eldamo]]'' considers the name ''Uldor'' to be Sindarin, its constituent parts are actually in [[Noldorin]] (which was a precursor language to Sindarin). A curious thing about the name ''Uldor'' is that it remained unchanged from its conception to the later [[legendarium]]. == Other versions of the legendarium == === Earlier versions of the ''[[Nirnaeth]]'' === According to earlier versions of the legendarium, instead of being killed by Maglor in the Battle of Unnumbered Tears, Uldor was slain by Cranthir (an earlier name for Caranthir) instead.{{SM|7I}}, entry '''172''', p. 302{{LR|AB}}, entry '''272''', p. 137 It is only in ''[[The Grey Annals]]'' (c. [[1951]]) that the story of Uldor's death at Maglor's hand appears, as well as the idea that Uldor summoned more Men from east of Beleriand.{{GA|231}}, entry '''472''', p. 74{{GA|231|note}}, p. 134 === Uldor's year of birth === In the appendix of ''[[The Lost Road and Other Writings]]'' in ''[[The Genealogies]]'' (dating from the early [[1930]]s), it is stated that Uldor was born in the year 125.{{LR|A1}}, p. 403 When comparing the above date with its associated text ''[[The Earliest Annals of Beleriand]]'', Uldor was born 38 years before the [[Swarthy Men]] entered Beleriand in the year 163.{{SM|7I}}, entry '''year 163''', p. 300 Also, the dates found in ''The Earliest Annals of Beleriand'' were by and large moved 300 years into the future in ''[[The Grey Annals]]'' (c. early [[1950]]s), such that, for example, an event happening in the year 195 in ''The Earliest Annals'' now happened in the year {{FA|495|n}}.{{SM|7Ic}}, ''Annals 155 to 157'', pp. 319-20 === Later legendarium === In the ''[[Narn i Chîn Húrin]]'', an entirely new conception of the Battle of Unnumbered Tears (''Nirnaeth Arnoediad'') emerged. According to that conception, the eastern army of Maedhros (called ''Maedros'' in this text) never rendezvoused with the western army of [[Fingon]] and [[Turgon]] at all - in other words, they were not simply delayed due to the actions of Uldor, but were completely cut off from the western army by a large host of [[Orcs]] and were subsequently routed. And while the idea of the treachery of the Easterlings was retained, it was only mentioned in passing.{{WJ|One}}, "Note 2 (''A further account of the Battle of Unnumbered Tears'')", pp. 165-8 {{references|notes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Uldor}} [[Category:Characters in The Silmarillion]] [[Category:Easterlings (First Age)]] [[Category:First Age characters]] [[Category:Noldorin names]] [[Category:Rulers in Beleriand]] [[Category:Servants of Melkor]] [[Category:Sindarin names]] [[de:Uldor]] [[fi:Uldor]] [[fr:encyclo/personnages/hommes/1a/orientaux/uldor]]
